The match was part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023.
India maintained their 100% record at the Cricket World Cup.
Virat Kohli was dismissed for a nine-ball duck by David Willey.
India's win leaves England rooted to the bottom of the standings.
India remain the sole undefeated team in the tournament with this win.
Rohit Sharma scored 87 runs off 101 balls, stabilizing India's innings.
The stadium was emptying behind the commentators as the match concluded.
India stay unbeaten with six wins in as many games and regain the top spot.
India's unchanged team took off at the back of Rohit Sharma's aggressive charge.
England remain at the bottom of the points table with their fifth defeat in six games.
England's next match is against Australia on November 4, which is a must-win for them.
India displaced South Africa at the top of the standings with 12 points in six matches.
England's spin-bowling all-rounders tried to rebuild but were undone by India's bowlers.
The match was held at Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow.
India's pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami ripped through the England top-order in Lucknow.
India are not mathematically into the semi-finals, nor are England mathematically out of the tournament.
England's World Cup defense is in a dire state, needing to win all remaining games and hoping for other results to go their way.
England's bowlers and fielders showed commitment and quality, with Chris Woakes delivering a seven-over opening spell that went for just 23 runs.
England's last four innings have ended in scores of 215, 170, 156 and 129. Against Sri Lanka, they went from 45-0 to 156 all out. Today, it is 30-0 to 129.
